info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 6:52AM EDT until July 14 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...The following counties, in central Ohio, Fairfield, Franklin and Pickaway.
* WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 652 AM EDT, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Columbus, Lancaster, Grove City, Pickerington, Circleville, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Ashville, Baltimore, Buckeye Lake, South Bloomfield, Millersport, Williamsport, Pleasantville, New Holland, Fairfield Beach, Obetz, Commercial Point, Royalton and Lithopolis.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Fairfield, OH; Franklin, OH; Pickaway, OH
